intro: Impatiens scripta, commonly known as the scarlet dwarf impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its small, showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features oval, glossy leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Impatiens scripta is also valued for its ability to bloom continuously throughout the growing season.
